From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To display debug information on references, use the **show memory debug references** command in user EXEC or privileged EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: (Optional) Displays the possible references to free memory.
(Optional) Address numbers <0-4294967295> that determine the address range.

Examples: The following is sample output from the show memory debug references command:
The following is sample output from the show memory debug references dangling command:
Router# show memory debug references dangling
[ Table 113 ] (#wp1560409) describes the significant fields shown in the displays.
Table 113 show memory debug references Field Descriptions
| Address | Hexadecimal address of the block having the given or dangling reference. |
| Reference | Address which is given or dangling. |
| Free_block | Address of the free block which now contains the memory referenced by the dangling reference. |
| Cont_block | Address of the control block which contains the block having the reference. |
| Cont_block_name | Name of the control block. |
ExtraInfo: All show memory debug commands must be used on customer networks only to diagnose the router for memory leaks when memory depletion is observed. These CLI's will have high CPU utilization and might result in time sensitive protocols to flap. These CLI's are recommended for customer use, only in the maintenance window when the router is not in a scaled condition.
